description: Cool dive, vintage decor, and games. Live music on Fridays and other certain occasions

machine_conditions.comment: Balls stuck in reel. Missing ball error message.
DMD is fixed.  Auto-plunger is still weak. Machine is dirty as all-get-out but works. Slopes to the right but it's set up on uneven ground. $0.50 per play
Auto launch is a little weak but otherwise plays nice.

location_machine_xrefs.condition: Well walker switch is stuck and constantly registers being hit. While it means plenty of multiball, you can't progress the other parts of the game.

machine_conditions.comment: Well walker switch is stuck and constantly registers being hit. While it means plenty of multiball, you can't progress the other parts of the game.

machine_conditions.comment: Toy ball lock won't register ball. Sometimes spits another ball out.

location_machine_xrefs.condition: Works great. Level bubble next to shooter is slightly above the lowest line indicating game is running somewhere between 6.5°-7.0° per Williams / Bally level indicators.

machine_conditions.comment: Works great. Level bubble next to shooter is slightly above the lowest line indicating game is running somewhere between 6.5°-7.0° per Williams / Bally level indicators.

Plays great, EXCEPT.... machine has FRONT leg levelers jacked all the way up making the ball float and difficult to trap/control. Balls often bounce or roll off flippers down the center drain. Original AFM manual says to set playfield at a 6-61/2 degree incline.
Working great. No credit dot. $1 per game or $2 for 3 games.
Table level is set to a difficult 7.5°

name: The Ice & Golf Center at Northwoods
description: Heavily routed machines that seem to never work, regardless of what titles are there. Operator switches between World Poker Tour, Medieval Madness, Scared Stiff, Nascar, and Junkyard. I've never played a well-functioning machine here

location_machine_xrefs.condition: Weak upper right flipper can't make left ramp, upper playfield (living room) flippers don't work, garage door not registering, and dirty. Just about what I expect from the operator here. The good news? Only$0.50 per play, or three for a dollar.

machine_conditions.comment: Weak upper right flipper can't make left ramp, upper playfield (living room) flippers don't work, garage door not registering, and dirty. Just about what I expect from the operator here. The good news? Only$0.50 per play, or three for a dollar.

$1/play.  Seems to be working well now!

Brand new. Left scoop fires straight down the middle. Machine uses a "games credits card scanner" device. $1.00 per play.
Eats quarters and the plunger does not eject them.
Mew, mew, mew, mew, mew, tilt tilt tilt tilt tilt tilt tilt tilt

Only the center quarter slot is untaped and it didn’t register quarters each time. Took about fifty times inserting quarters to get to to give the confirmation sound that the quarters actually registered for a four player game. The good news is you can hit coin return button and it give you the non-registered quarter back it just takes a while to feed the machine and to get it to register your money. Other than that it’s in good working order from what I can tell .

Played it 7 times today with the wife on the fifth game we noticed a small screw with a lock washer fall down the play field and into the curtain. Then when ball drained it refused to eject the ball for a while. Then ball ejected for my turn and in the middle of my turn Flippers stopped working and it moved I next player. Note it didn’t say tilt when it did this
Door plunger is sporadically not firing when triggered. Sometimes, a two ball multiball occurs with this plunger issue.
New flipper coil stops, shooting stronger

Good condition. Sometimes the back ball capture doesn’t work when shooting from plunger.
